column5: Hi all,  Finally got out in the boat for a good session. Was out on the lake by 6am with high enthusiasm but low expectations.....late iceout could have the fish anywhere than where they should be.   Turns out they were pretty close to where they usually are just shallower (14' being the key depth all morning.   Stayed for just over 5 hours and must have caught close to 15 walleye, none under 22" and the best at 30.5". With the water temperature between 48 and 51F the trout were out to play too and I boaters 4. Inbetween the Walters an Lakers the bass and pike came out to play.....got a really nice 40" pike!  Only moved once when the walleye bite died, went in search for them deep but nothing there.   Basically turned on the spot lock on the Minn Kota and the fish came to me...really needed a good session interest boat...and for what amounted to this years maiden voyage was not disappointed!   All fish on large dace minnows and 3/8oz chartreuse jig...simple but deadly today it seemed.   When I got home my boy was just going for a nap but he saw me pull up with the boat...that was it.....he wanted to go fishing...so after his nap we all headed to a local pond and had supper in the boat...while the wife and I threw topwaters getting a few pike and bass, while Jack netted the only walleye of the evening.    WALLEYE, LAKERS, BASS and PIKE video                                                             ,                       We all slept very well after lots of fresh air.   Happy memories.
That's an amazing report Simon!  Great outing for sure.!
Nice haul, and I was gonna upgrade our pike for the tourney but it looks like yours is allot bigger.  Nice work I couldn't beat your eye or whitie either. That water is still way cold up there.
Nice haul! I can't believe the color of the L trout flesh. Good on ya!
you're lucky to live up there, nice letting the biggies go, cool video
awesome outing. what a  way to start the soft water season
Amazing.  The whole neighbourhood came out for a bite...you deserve it.  Loving the cold water this year!
Awesome day Simon, way to go!
Nice! Chartruse jigs...killer colour.
Well done Simon !!!! You sure have paradise up there !!!! Was a banner day for sure !!!!! What times is pickerel dinner served ??? Lol
WOW!  Dream day, Simon! You have to love a mixed bag like that in 14ft of water!  ONE STEP BEYOOOOOOOND!!!!!
a complete adventure. awsome to see a family outing..
Awesome time, it looks like it was a great day for sure.  Love those family outings!
You know, if you had a fishing show with just video like the above, I would watch it! Thanks for posting this... and Jack's tackel box is way cool! HH
WOW1 That is a morning of fishing, on fabled waters.i have dreamed of since childhood. Truly remarkable stuff!  Many thanks for taking the time posting this!
As always Simon, your videos never disappoint.  Fantastic start to your soft water season!!   :clapping:  :worthy:   Thanks for taking the time and posting.
Geez Simon if thats just the beginning of the season, i going to have to upgrade my internet bandwidth just watch all of your videos ... awesome job dude !!!
Now that is one SICK outing right there. Congrats Simon on boating some outstanding fish!!!
Multi species master!
very nice outing!
Again, had to take a look at this most incredible episode of morning fishing.
